infantry_focus.name: Infantry Focus
infantry_focus.background: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

airborne_focus.name: Airborne Focus
airborne_focus.background: Airborne infantry and deceptive sabotage tactics.

armored_focus.name: Armored Focus
armored_focus.background: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

forward_artillery_observer.name: Forward Observer (Artillery)
forward_artillery_observer.description: An artillery forward observer able to call in a fire mission.

riflemen.name: Rifle Squad
riflemen.description: A group of trained US Riflemen.

armored_riflemen.name: Armored Rifle Squad
armored_riflemen.description: A group of trained US Riflemen.

veteran_armored_riflemen.name: Veteran Armored Rifle Squad
veteran_armored_riflemen.description: A group of trained US Riflemen.

rangers.name: Rangers
rangers.description: A group of trained US Rangers.

glider_rifle_squad.name: Glider Rifle Squad
glider_rifle_squad.description: A group of trained US Riflemen dropped in gliders.

airborne_squad.name: Airborne Squad
airborne_squad.description: A group of trained US Airborne.

veteran_airborne_squad.name: Veteran Airborne Squad
veteran_airborne_squad.description: A group of trained US Airborne.

combat_engineers.name: Combat Engineers
combat_engineers.description: A squad of us combat engineers.

flamethrower_team.name: Flamethrower Team
flamethrower_team.description: A team equipped to clear bunkers and other defensive positions.

sniper_team.name: Sniper Team
sniper_team.description: A team equipped to take out important targets from a distance.

sniper_team_airborne.name: Sniper Team (Airborne)
sniper_team_airborne.description: A team equipped to take out important targets from a distance.

bazooka_team.name: Bazooka Team
bazooka_team.description: A team dedicated to hunting heavy tanks.

veteran_bazooka_team.name: Veteran Bazooka Team
veteran_bazooka_team.description: A team dedicated to hunting heavy tanks.

airborne_bazooka_team.name: Bazooka Team (Airborne)
airborne_bazooka_team.description: A team dedicated to hunting heavy tanks.

light_mortar_team.name: Light Mortar Team
light_mortar_team.description: A light mortar carried by a small team.

medium_mortar_team.name: Medium Mortar Team
medium_mortar_team.description: A medium mortar carried by a small team.

heavy_mortar_team.name: Heavy Mortar Team
heavy_mortar_team.description: A heavy mortar carried by a small team.

m16_rocket_launcher.name: M16 Rocket Launcher
m16_rocket_launcher.description: A wheeled light rocket artillery piece.

m20_scout_car.name: M20 Scout Car
m20_scout_car.description: An armored recon car with a powerful autocannon.

m8_greyhound.name: M8 Greyhound
m8_greyhound.description: An armored recon car with a powerful autocannon.

m3_stuart.name: M3 Stuart
m3_stuart.description: A medium tank with a decent all-round AT gun.

m4_sherman.name: M4 Sherman
m4_sherman.description: A medium tank with a decent all-round AT gun.

m4_sherman_command.name: M4 Sherman (Command)
m4_sherman_command.description: A medium tank with a decent all-round AT gun.

m4a1_sherman.name: M4A1 Sherman
m4a1_sherman.description: A medium tank with a decent all-round AT gun.

m4a1_sherman_command.name: M4A1 Sherman (Command)
m4a1_sherman_command.description: A medium tank with a decent all-round AT gun.

m4a3e8_easy_eight.name: M4A3E8 "Easy Eight"
m4a3e8_easy_eight.description: A medium tank with a decent all-round AT gun.

m4a3e2_sherman_jumbo.name: M4A3E2 Sherman Jumbo
m4a3e2_sherman_jumbo.description: A heavy assault tank with optional heavy gun.

m26_pershing.name: M26 Pershing
m26_pershing.description: A heavy assault tank with optional heavy gun.

m18_hellcat.name: M18 Hellcat
m18_hellcat.description: A lightly armored but fast tank destroyer.

m10_tank_destroyer.name: M10 Tank Destroyer
m10_tank_destroyer.description: A medium tank with a decent all-round AT gun.

m36_jackson.name: M36 Jackson
m36_jackson.description: A medium tank with a decent all-round AT gun.

m36b_jackson.name: M36B1 Jackson
m36b_jackson.description: A medium tank with a decent all-round AT gun.

m3_white_scout.name: M3 White Scout Car
m3_white_scout.description: A lightly armored scout transport car.

fire_and_move.name: Fire and Move
fire_and_move.flavor: With a doctrine of mobile warfare, US Infantry advance and fire with great effect.
fire_and_move.description: Use when an Infantry unit with any Assault weapons is firing. That unit does not suffer -1 to hit when using the Assault rule.

scouting_team.name: Scouting Team
scouting_team.flavor: US Infantry units would often form small scouting teams to scout out the route ahead.
scouting_team.description: Use instead of your activation. Choose 3 models from an Infantry unit to become a new scouting team unit. That unit immediately activates and is treated as a separate unit for the remainder of the game. This strategy may only be used once per Infantry unit.

look_alive.name: Look Alive
look_alive.flavor: Situational awareness can be key in combat.
look_alive.description: Use when an Infantry unit attemps a reaction test. That unit is treated as having an Initiative of 9.

recrew.name: Recrew (Infantry)
recrew.flavor: It's highly important to keep artillery pieces manned and fighting.
recrew.description: Use at the beginning of a round where an Infantry unit is within 2" of an Artillery unit. Remove X models from the Infantry unit and add restore X crew to the Artillery unit.

target_weak_point.name: Target Weak Point (Infantry)
target_weak_point.flavor: Exploiting weak points an an enemy's armor is key to taking out hard targets.
target_weak_point.description: Use before shooting with an Infantry or Artillery unit's weapon with AP 3 or higher. That attack is treated as hitting the target's side.

frag_out.name: Frag Out (Infantry)
frag_out.flavor: A volley of hand grenades can be quite effective at dealing with enemies in cover.
frag_out.description: Use before shooting with an Infantry unit that has Grenades (any type). That unit may throw 2 additional grenades.

armored_assault.name: Armored Assault (Armored)
armored_assault.flavor: Occasionally armored units are used to push infantry and other units off a dug in position.
armored_assault.description: Use when a Vehicle unit declares a Charge action. It is treated as having Shock(+3) for that action.

improvised_tactics.name: Improvised Tactics (Armored)
improvised_tactics.flavor: Sometimes it is necessary to improvise in an armored engagement in order to gain the edge.
improvised_tactics.description: Use when a Vehicle unit is attempting a reaction test. It is treated as having Initiative 9 for this test.

crew_repairs.name: Emergency Repairs (Armored)
crew_repairs.flavor: In moments of dire circumstance crews may need to repair their vehicle in combat.
crew_repairs.description: Use when a Vehicle unit is activated. That unit may repair one critical damage caused by a penetrating hit.

combat_drop.name: Combat Drop (Airborne)
combat_drop.flavor: A well-trained paratroop unit can drop as close as posssible to their intended target.
combat_drop.description:
Set one Infantry, Artillery or Airborne Vehicle unit aside in reserves before the match begins. At the beginning of any round after the first you may attempt to place the unit anywhere on the table over 12" away from enemy units.

Take a Courage test. If failed, use D10 scattering to determine the unit's new landing location. If the new location is off the table, place the unit at table edge as close as possible. If both players have units with Airdrop they must roll-off to see who deploys first, and then alternate in placing them.

tough_fighters.name: Tough Fighters (Airborne)
tough_fighters.flavor: Some of the toughest units to fight in a close combat brawl are trained Airborne units.
tough_fighters.description: Use before an Infantry unit uses a fight action. Its attacks gain AP1.

stealth_tactics.name: Stealth Tactics (Airborne)
stealth_tactics.flavor: Moving quickly and quietly is a key part of Airborne training.
stealth_tactics.description: Use when activating an Infantry unit. It may make a free 6" move action and may not be targetted by reaction fire when doing so.

natural_leader.name: Natural Leader
natural_leader.description: This unit and friendly Infantry units within 6" get +1 Courage and +1 Initiative.

defensive_fire.name: Defensive Fire
defensive_fire.description: This unit and friendly Infantry units within 6" get +1 Accuracy when using an Ambush reaction.

move_it.name: Move It
move_it.description: When this unit is activated, this unit and friendly Infantry units within 6" may immediately remove one strain.

mobile_expert.name: Mobile Expert
mobile_expert.description: This unit may move and fire assault weapons without suffering the -1 to hit penalty.

richard_winters.name: Richard Davis Winters
richard_winters.flavor: A natural leader and an excellent officer, Richard Winters lead his Parachute unit through D-Day and beyond.
richard_winters.description: Upgrade one Field Officer model with Natural Leader.

turner_turnbull.name: Turner 'Brashears' Turnbull III
turner_turnbull.flavor: Turner Turnbull organized his men and against all odds held out a German counter-attack at Neuville-au-Plein.
turner_turnbull.description: Upgrade one Field Officer model with Defensive Fire.

dutch_cota.name: Norman 'Dutch' Cota
dutch_cota.flavor: Cota lead American forces on the beaches of Normandy and inspired his men under severe enemy fire.
dutch_cota.description: Upgrade one Field Officer model with Move It.

lafayette_pool.name: Lafayette G. Pool
lafayette_pool.flavor: Lafayette Pool used a mix of suprise and mobile tactics to outwit his armored opponents.
lafayette_pool.description: Upgrade one M4 Sherman or M4A1 Sherman with Mobile Expert.
